content:
The first section under Settings/Calendar/Reminders has the sound settings.

Try running Windows in safe mode to bypass startup apps that might be causing poor performance, then test TB. Slow reactions with calendars, either local or network, is not common unless an external app is interfering.

I'm not familiar with syncing Efficient Reminder in TB, as most users add accounts with providers like Google, outlook.com, AOL etc. that offer CalDAV access. There are also calendar-like add-ons like mailmindr.

content:
It's not a matter of how many startup apps or RAM you have, but the kind of app, especially antivirus which have a long history of degrading TB performance, unless the TB profile folder is excluded from AV scanning.

TB is particular with sound files. Files that are wav format work best, and it is easy to convert mp3 to wav.

See the picture that shows the Save & Close button for tasks. It's also available under Task on the Menu Bar, or Ctrl+L.

The Default settings can left on, which doesn't affect the ability to set them for each task or event.

creator: sfhowes

content:
Globálna databáza je indexovací systém umožňujúcí Thunderbirdu vyhľadávať v zprávach. Znovuvytvorenie globálnej databázy preindexuje správy a vizitky z adresára. (Správy z konferencií nie sú indexované.)

Postup znovuvytvorenia globálnej databázy: - Ukončite Thunderbird. - Vyhľadajte vo svojom profile Thunderbirdu súbor global-messages-db.sqlite - Vymažte tento súbor. - Spustite Thunderbird. Automaticky sa začne proces vytvárania indexu. V závislosti na počte správ môže indexácia trvať dosť dlhý čas (cca 5 minút). Počas indexácie môžete Thunderbird používat, iba bude znížený jeho výkon a vyhľadávania prinesú iba čiastočné výsledky, alebo dokonca žiadne. Proces indexácie môžete sledovať v Správcovi aktivít (ponuka Nástroje > Správca činnosti).

content: Ďaľšie možnosti nápravy. 1. Robí to niektorý už nekompatibilný doplnok. Odporúčam vypnúť všetky doplnky. A ak bude po probléme, potom postupne zapínať jednotlivé doplnky, až zistite, ktorý to robí. Ten doplnok ktorý to spôsobuje dočasne zakázať dovtedy, pokiaľ autor tohoto doplnku neurobí opravu a neaktualizuje ho pre najnovšiu verziu Thunderbirdu. 2. Tento problém tiež spôsoboval agresívne nastavený antivírusový program. Skúste mu pre kontrolu pridať výnimku, alebo ho úplne vypnúť (odstrániť). Spravidla sú sťažnosti na Avast u ktorého ale vraj stačí iba vypnúť "Štít súborového systému". 3. Vo viacerých prípadoch tiež pomohol NOVÝ profil Thunderbirdu.
creator: Ansamb

content:
Děkuji ze rady, problém se však odstranit nepodařilo. 1. Zkoušel jsem spustit "Režim řešení potíží", který dočasně zakáže všechny doplňky. To nemá žádný vliv. 2. Antivirus vliv také nemá. 3. Stáhl jsem si Thuderbird portable (abych měl jinou "instalaci" na PC). Dále jsem do něj naimportoval emaily z původního Thuderbirdu. Opět bez úspěchu, emaily, které nezobrazí původní Thuderbird se nezobrazí ani v portable verzi.

Vyzkoušel jsem dále software "MailStore Home", který by měl emaily archivovat, avšak ani do něj se tyto emaily nenačtou. Nenečte se zde ani informace o korespondentech, datu emailu, adt., které v Thunderbirdu vidím. Z laického pohledu mně přijde, že to vypadá, jako kdyby tyto emaily nebyly v datovém souboru.

Jak uvádí @janamkv zřejmě je to po poslední aktualizaci Thunderbirdu a projevuje se jen u některých složek (u mě konkrétně u odeslané pošty).

content:
Per bloccare l'aggiornamento automatico: Menu > Impostazioni > Generale Scorri fino alla sezione Aggiornamenti Seleziona l'opzione Controlla aggiornamenti ma permetti all’utente di scegliere se installarli

Per eliminare anche la notifica:

  • vai nella cartella in cui è installato l'eseguibile thunderbird.exe
  • apri la cartella distribution (se non esiste, creala)
  • al suo interno crea un file di testo con nome policies.json
  • all'interno del file copia questo codice

{ 

 "policies": {    "DisableAppUpdate": true  }

}

  • salva il file che sarà attivo dal successivo riavvio di Thunderbird

content: I suggest unzipping to individual folders within Windows, and then use the importexporttools addon to import them into select folders. Either that, or exit thunderbird and copy the folders to the Mail\Local Folders folder in windows file explorer.

content: Hej, niestety podczas rozpakowywania z pliku 40 GB wywala błędy i rozpakowany folder ma 1 GB. Czy dodatek importexporttool ng obsługuje pliki ZIP powyżej 2 GB?
creator: dzidanserwis

content: My suggestion is that a zip file that big should be unzipped using Windows tools (or the free 7zip). If you created the zip with Thunderbird, there may be problems with the file, as Thunderbird advises not to exceed 2gig, My reference to the importexport addon was to import unzipped mbox files after a successful unzip. If you haven't done this already, I encourage trying the free 7zp utility at https://www.7-zip.org/ to see if it will successfully unzip the file. If it does, you can then post a screenshot of the contents and we can assist in getting the data back into a thunderbird profile.

creator: john391

content:
johne53 said
BTW is this the wrong place to be asking questions about Mozilla Thunderbird? Very few questions seem to get any answers :-(

This is a peer support from where answers come from fellow Thunderbird users. There is a lack of tolerance for poorly though out questions, posting of incorrect information and general comments about things being slow. (more on that later) but fundamentally questions about things being slow are largely a waste of everyone's time as most want someone else to do the fixing for them and the only real answer that can be offered is. https://wiki.mozilla.org/Thunderbird:Testing:Memory_Usage_Problems

Your topic is more unlikely to attract much interest because there is not a Thunderbird 116. There is a version 128 that has been released for limited update on non 32 bit systems and direct download. Yours is a 32 bit system you say so the latest release version available for you is 115.14. I suggest you refer to Wikipedia for your release information. I do. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/History_of_Mozilla_Thunderbird

Sure you found the archive, but unless you know what you are looking at you will be downloading daily developer builds and beta software. (that is the 129 series listed there.) Again have a look at Wikipedia.

Having offered the link to memory troubleshooting which is the same process for "slowness" there are standard diagnostics for all general issues including slowness and hangs below. These apply especially post update when third part products are most likely to be messing things up.

Please provide results for the following test on your system

  1. Does Thunderbird work as expected in Thunderbird troubleshooting mode?
  2. Does Thunderbird work as expected with your OS started in safe mode with Networking. Instructions for each operating system: Windows 10/11, Windows 8, Windows 7, OSX

content:
After some further testing I've a bit more info...

  • The main thing I discovered was that the slowness/hanging only happens if an incoming email contains a link to the internet (usually to the sender's web site). During downloads, if none of the emails contain hyperlinks, the slowness never happens.
  • If any incoming email does contain a link, emails from certain senders will cause the slowness issue while others don't (no idea why...)
  • I figured out how to roll back to the original ver115.0. The problematic emails now take around 15secs to download and if I click on T/bird during this time, the GUI goes through a "whiteout" effect (which I'd previously thought was a c r a s h). However in 115.0 that effect only lasts for around 12secs or so. This is hugely shorter than ver115.14.0 where I was seeing whiteouts lasting 80secs or even longer.
  • The whiteout effects only happen when the email account's server is a POP server (doesn't happen if IMAP).
  • I then took Matt's advice and rebooted into Safe Mode with Networking (Windows 10 / 32-bit). The problematic emails now download slightly quicker (under 10 seconds) and there's no longer any whiteout effect if I click my T/bird GUI while there's a download in progress.

I'm not sure if this gets us any further but the performace and timings in Safe Mode look much more like normal operation.
creator: john391

The problematic emails now download slightly quicker (under 10 seconds) and there's no longer any whiteout effect if I click my T/bird GUI while there's a download in progress. I'm not sure if this gets us any further but the performace and timings in Safe Mode look much more like normal operation.

Windows safe mode disables anti-virus software, which is most likely the culprit. These are some generic suggestions to avoid problems with anti-virus software.

Create an exception in your anti-virus software for the Thunderbird profile folder, so that the anti-virus real-time scanner will not scan it. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/profiles-where-thunderbird-stores-user-data#w_how-to-find-your-profile

Don't let your anti-virus software scan incoming and outgoing messages.

Don't let your anti-virus software scan attachments.

Don't let your anti-virus software intercept your secure connection to the server.

Remove any add-ons your anti-virus software may have installed in Thunderbird.

content:
I found a solution!

First I did a fresh install via the flatpak method in a VirtualBox instance of Ubuntu 22.04 which never had Thunderbird in it before. I saw none of the previously discussed issues and noted it was v128.1.0.

I compared how my laptop was running v128.0.1, not quite up to date despite having just upgraded. Then I read how flatpak upgrades are always the most recent.

The solution (after backing up ~/.thunderbird of course):

sudo apt remove thunderbird flatpak install flathub org.mozilla.Thunderbird

Also had to replace the new ~/.var/app/org.mozilla.Thunderbird/.thunderbird with the old /.thunderbird, then:

flatpak run org.mozilla.Thunderbird --profilemanager
creator: lionelholt

content: thanks for sharing. Your post reminds me of how little I know about Linux. :)

Měl jsem stejný problém, platný certifikát PostSignum, importované rootové certifikáty jako Důvěryhodné (což je důležité). Nešla odeslat podepsaná pošta. Mimo Win Antivir na PC nemám. Pomohl výše uvedený postup (Ansam 07.08.24 8:57):

1. Odstranění z Thunderbirdu elektronického podpisu 2. Restart Thunderbirdu 3. Import do Thunderbirdu elektronický podpis (ten odstraněný) 4. Restart Thunderbirdu 5. Odeslaná podepsaná pošta OK

content: Since you are receiving error for no authentication and the SMTP settings show no authentication, I suggest you try some settings, such as 'normal password' and see if that satisfies your email system. That needs correction anyway, as most email providers now demand authentication if incoming emails
creator: davidsk

content: Thank you David. Worked. I don't understand any of this but it worked!
creator: 84biarritz

content: You're welcome. To educate you briefly, the server sees you sending from mtsbiz.net and wants to confirm if you're authorized to use the mtsbiz.net mail server, so it asks for authentication that you are a legitimate user. This protects them from people using the server who are not authorized and such senders will normally be seen as spammers -- using a legitimate mail server illegitimately. There, more than you ever wanted to know, but now when asked at the dinner table whether you learned anything today, you will shine.  :) Enjoy.

Use the server described in the article - smtp.office365.com. OAuth2 isn't available for smtp-mail.outlook.com.

creator: mousehold

content:
The colour of the highlight and other elements, such as the New Message button, take the Windows colours if the System Theme is selected in the add-ons manager. To apply the standard TB colours, use the Light Theme.

To set the colour, independent of theme, see this topic:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1456609

creator: malcolmhay

content: Reinstalling the program probably won't help, as most issues are due to flaws in the (separate) profile folder. Try creating a new profile from Help/Troubleshooting Info, about:profiles, add an account, and if it works properly, data can be transferred from the old profile to the new. IMAP accounts in the new profile will sync with the mail server on first connection.
creator: sfhowes

content: I removed ALL my contacts from TBird, as some had been imported from google some time ago, the pop ups then stopped. So I will now try and reinstate gmail and see what happens, if it goes bad again I will have to do as you say & start a new profile. Thanks for your help in this, much appreciated!

content: - if you see the 'quick filter' button above message list pane, click the small icon to its right. If you do NOT see the quick filter button, click view>layout and tick 'message list header' and then click the icon described. content: There is no 116esr release, so I'm curious what you're seeing. Would you please post a screenshot of the help>about pane? Thanks.
creator: davidsk

content:
Yes, I know. on machine B it looks like this upgrade to 116. On the other machine (A) where the same prompt was offered, the update failed and now it only offers update to esr channel.

So why do identical current versions offer two different updates?
creator: mark567

content:
Hmm the Thunderbird 116.0 to 127.0 were Beta test builds as they are not listed on the Release Notes page at https://www.thunderbird.net/thunderbird/releases/ so you should technically not be getting a prompt to a version like 116.0 which is old now also anyways.

The Thunderbird devs does plan to have rapid Release versions alongside the ESR channels in future as you can see in https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/thunderbird-128-nebula-faq
creator: James

content:
Thank you. So I will have to take the chance and hope the second machine follows the same update path as the first (fails 116 upgrade, then defaults to the lower esr version).

As long as both of my machines end up at the same version at the same time, that's what I need. But why am I now switched to ESR channel, when I wasn't before? How do I get back on the release channel?
creator: mark567

content: The release channel is now known as the ESR channel.
creator: davidsk

content:
david said
The release channel is now known as the ESR channel.

Considering the Thunderbird devs plan to have a rapid Release in near future, this perhaps means the Tb 128.0 will be the current version on ESR channel along side the Release channel as per https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/thunderbird-128-nebula-faq

The older Tb 115 ESR is almost at an end as last update will be 115.15.0esr in early September (like with Firefox 115.15.0esr) unless there is an extension.
creator: James

content:
Follow-up: I updated the 2nd machine and sure enough it did the same thing as the first one: the offered update to 116 immediately failed, then it switched to offering 115.x.x, so I still have my two versions in sync as desired.

And for future reference, if you didn't know, by creating a manual Windows system restore point right before the update, it looks like I could have rolled it back if it hadn't gone the way I wanted.

Thanks to all who replied.
creator: mark567

content: The -- at the beginning looks like a signature separator. Check Account Settings for each account to see if an incompatible file is attached as a signature. Only html, txt and picture files are allowed.
creator: sfhowes

content:
Hi sf: All this time has passed without improvement of the problem because I had no clue as to what you were speaking of when you mention "The -- at the beginning looks like a signature separator. Check Account Settings for each account to see if an incompatible file is attached as a signature. Only html, txt and picture files are allowed." 

 My digital knowledge is minimal; I find that often times folks such as yourself presume you are speaking with folks whose experience is somewhere near yours, and that is not so in this instance.  Finally, fed up with the issue I went to the settings page of Thunderbird. In a box on the settings page was a >Signature text< section. Below it was >Attach the signature from a file instead (text, HTML, or image): with a file link that we did not enter, to wit > C:\Users\dchrn\OneDrive\Pictures\ControlCenter4\Scan\Bipap Compliance 11.8.22 - 12.7.22.pdf

The box next to that file reference was checked. I unchecked it and the problem has gone away. Thank you, D. Newhouse

creator: MrYossu

content:
Found a solution, posting here in case it helps anyone.

When restarting TB, the main tab was blank. If I clicked View -> Folders, I could see that nothing was selected, hence the blank tab. However, even clicking on something didn't help.

What I only found out by trial and error was that if you click on a folder and then restart TB, when it restarts, the folder is visible.

Seems like a bug, but at least I know how to work around it.
creator: MrYossu
